column5: We fished for trout for few hrs today.Will go for walleye maybe during week.Rather trout fish for a while yet.Ill try Wednesday for walleye.
Weather looks awesome
Going to get hot.
Along with the heat the fishing will heat up big time
Curious, whats the water temp right now? Im guessing mid 50s ?
Yesterday main lake was 48-49 f.Bays were mid 50,s and up depending how shallow you went.This is on a deep clear trout lake so shallower walleye lakes coukd be a few degrees higher.
https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&sour...rP_YglSLrmq6HxTry this Bill
Yup, nice fish!!!! Bill
John if we can make it up in August we want to book you again for Cedar lake crappie!! Will bring brat burgers again. How is the depth of Cedar?
There's some .catch them fishing muskie here and there.You will end up with more muskies

Thanks as I’ve seen a resort at the All Canada Show and they seem to have a good package they offer. What would you consider in your neck of the woods the best Pike lake (a mess of perch in it would even make it better hah)?
As far as pike go I'd have to say Clay Lake and Lac Suel.
It's down a bit like everywhere but that won't be a problem.Hope that will happen.That was a heck of a day we all had and the bbq burgers were a real treat in the boat.
That will wear the knife out

Rod that crew was staying up near Earfalls and and I think they ended up taking the fish up there to clean so i got out of that deal.haha.I would normally use my electric knife on those.about a minute per fish.
That's one mess of slab crappies,I would probably come up with not feeling good and having to go lay down at cleaning time
Can the lake withstand taking loads of crappies from it?

Seems like there is no shortage of them if you know we're to fish for them.The spawn is so easy but then after that through summer most people give up on them as they get tough to find.So basically there untouched.With the second year of covid now and another spawn year coming iam sure their numbers will climb.Wife and I are ready for them.
[QUOTE=Eckohlt;6560346]Must be nice! While I shed a tear[/QUOTE]keep the faith Rod.You never know still thinking fall but our country likes shut downs and making people go broke.
Nice pics and just looks peaceful up there. Is there much of a Northern population in Cliff?
[QUOTE=prov1800;6560370]You hit the nail right on the head
[QUOTE=prov1800;6560370]There doing a lot of unnecessary damage right now

Must be nice! While I shed a tear[/QUOTE]keep the faith Rod.You never know still thinking fall but our country likes shut downs and making people go broke.[/QUOTE]There doing a lot of unnecessary damage right now[/QUOTE]Eck,Odds are looking better after the “announcement” today which would be tough to keep things closed. Get the cold weather gear ready as October could be a go.
I heard today that only 50 percent of the Canadian population has been vaccinated 1st one ?

Latest data I can find shows 42% of Canadians have 1 shot and only 3.5 % are fully vaccinated.Very unfortunate the supply of vaccine to Canada has been so limited. People do need to get vaccinated . If you don't believe vaccinations are necessary please make an effort to educate yourself. I greatly miss my trips to Canada. I do not think the border will and should reopen until at least 70% of Americans and Canadians have been fully vaccinated. Encourage everyone you know to get vaccinated as soon as they can so we can all go fishing in Canada again.
Nope
Why only 70% ?

There doing a lot of unnecessary damage right now[/QUOTE] Eck, Odds are looking better after the announcement today which would be tough to keep things closed. Get the cold weather gear ready as October could be a go.[/QUOTE] I'll be ready I'm sure fall is a go,it's looking up for us cold weather fisherman
Thx.Cliff lake kind off a special place to my wife and i.Those pristine clear waters are a joy to be on.Catching fish is a bonus.
Thanks for the great pictures. Makes me miss being up there even more.

Had a couple of outings on Cliff again.Got out with my son Monday and then a solo trip yesterday..Both days great weather.Have been fishing deeper water but targeting the bait schools higher up in the water column.Just need to put lure inside the school and keep it there lots of fish feeding and doesnt rake long to get hooked up.
Nice fish!!! Bill
Couple more from Monday
Must be nice! While I shed a tear
Great pics thanks for sharing. It doesn't look like I'll be making my trip mid July. Looks like the water is a bit low??
Most lakes are down but can get boat in most placès.
So my son took a video and I downloaded it on YouTube.Not sure it will work.Not tgat tech savvy.here is link to it.https://youtu.be/-lgMb2Lfdvk
So i typed it in and it worked.???

Got out for awesome day of trout fishing with my wife today.Beautifull blue skies and no wind and temps at 20c.Couldnt ask for a nicer day.Found some baitfish and dropped our tubes down and proceeded to catch a bunch of trout.Ended up with 9 in the boat by noon.wife 7.John 2.Lol.Veiws on the lake today we're iñcredible.
The crystell clear waters of Cliff Lake are beautifull to fish in.
Oh ya that's get'er done john n better half,beautiful to say the least
Absolutely absolutely gorgeous!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Bill

When I look at picture #3 I can just envision watching Smallies (or snot rockets) hitting a crankbait thrown from a boat into the rocks and worked back as it nears deeper water and more round head size type of rocks. Dang...... having to wait another year is painful for an old guy without a lot of years left. Thanks, and keep our interest up with pictures. Pooch

Thx for the comments on the pics guys.The lake has unreal bass fishing for sure.Can get some pike but mostly you will get muskies.Those spots will come alive soon with spawning smallies.We will get out there for that as we do every year and my wife will be smoking them on her fly rod.Always fun to see that.Best part is with the clear water you can sight fish them.
Your pics are making my heart pound. I can hardly believe I'm going to miss another early summer trip to God's country! I'm gad you are able to enjoy it.

I can't imagine what it would be like not to be able to come up here.We are very lucky to have everything so close and able to enjoy it.This time of year is our favorite as everything is turning green again and having the earky open water is a bonus.

I can't imagine what it would be like not to be able to come up here.We are very lucky to have everything so close and able to enjoy it.This time of year is our favorite as everything is turning green again and having the earky open water is a bonus.
Congrats on the fish and great pics. Gotta love the northern lakes so beautiful.
